value.0: The timeless gaze of this long forgotten heroine stares at you.
A portal glows softly before you. You wonder where it leads.

Do not drop items to ground, they will be automatically deleted after 1 minute. Use the bankchest or ask a player to do the transfer. Items in any placeables are save.

Please still use the trash can in each town or the "destroyer" in your inventory to prevent lag. Do not drop junk because this new script is in.

38 Cleric 1 Ranger 1 Monk 

Race 
Elf (Subrace: Darkelf) 

Starting Stats: (Subrace values) 
8 Strength (-2) 
18 Dexterity 
10 constitution 
14 Intelligence 
16 Wisdom (+4) 
8 charisma (-2) 

Attribute Allocation 
Every 4 levels increase wisdom by 1 (by 10, by level 40). 

Leveling Order 
38 Cleric, 1 Ranger, 1 Monk 

Cleric Domains: Evil, Trickery 

Preepic Feats (7) 
1. Weapon finesse (required to make Horn/EQ based on dexterity) 
2. Silent Spell 
3. Skill focus Discipline 
4. Spell Focus Conjuration 
5. Greater Spell focus Conjuration 
6. Expertise 
7. Improved Expertise (for +10 AC when not casting for survivability) 

Epic Feats (7) 
21 Epic Fortitude 
24 Great Wisdom 
27 Great Wisdom 
30 Great Wisdom 
33 Great Wisdom 
36 Epic Skill Focus Concentration (or pick any feat of choice, epic reflexes) 
39 Epic Skill focus Discipline (must maximize Discipline) 

Cleric bonus Feats 
23 Armor skin 
26 Epic Spell focus Conjuration 
29 Great Wisdom 
32 Great Wisdom 
35 Great Wisdom 
38 Great Wisdom 

Ranger bonus Feat (at level 39) 
Improved Combat Casting (must have concentration maxed to take) 

Free Feats 
Combat Casting (from being Darkelf) 

Skill Points: 
43 Discipline (maximize on ranger level 39, and Monk 40) 
40 tumble (take all at 40 monk) 
11 Listen (+2 elf, +2 Alertness +20 wisdom modifier = 35 listen) 
43 concentration (to resist Taunting) 
39 Spellcraft (every 5 spellcraft on sheet will give 1 save versus spells) 

35 Listen is required. Using CC and AMP potions for +30 listen, to reach 65 listen. Casting true seeing will then grant "True true seeing". 65 Spot also grants True True seeing. 

Stats 
AC: 75 
Fortitude 50 (with Prayer and Battletide) 
Discipline 77 (with Divine Power and Prayer). 

Gear: (11 items) 
Robe: 5 AC 4 Discipline 
Belt: 8 Dexterity 
Bracer: 8 Wisdom 
Ring: 4 Discipline 
Ring: 5 Fortitude 
Amulet: 5 AC 4 Dexterity 4 Wisdom 
Boot: 5 AC 8 Constitution 
Cloak: 5 AC 5 Fortitude 
Helmet: 5 Fortitude 
Weapon1: 4 Discipline 
Weapon2: 4 Discpline 

Note: No Strength is on items as Divine Power spell will increase strength to 18 (which so happens to be the cap for this build). 

Alternatives: 

Can take Travel domain for Web spells, or Magic Domain for Ice Storms (take Maximized spell instead of ESF Concentration then). Replacing Epic Concentration with epic reflexes helps against SoV (Storm of vengence). 

Taking more listen (or spot instead of listen) and less spellcraft. This will help only when true seeing is dispelled, against sneakers. 

Other variations include 33 Cleric 5 Harper 2 Monk, 29 Cleric 10 CoT 1 Monk, 32 Cleric 6 CoT 2 Monk. 

-------------------- 
Fighter 28 Bard 2 Red Dragon (RDD) 10 

Race 
Dwarf (Subrace: Duergar) 

Starting Stats: (Subrace values) 
18 Strength (+2) 
8 Dexterity (-2) 
14 constitution(+2) 
16 Intelligence (-2) 
8 Wisdom 
6 charisma 

Attribute Allocation 
Every 4 levels increase Strength by 1 (by 10, by level 40). 

Leveling Order 
20 Fighter, 1 Bard, 10 Rdd, 8 Fighter, 1 Bard 

Preepic Feats (7) 
1. Luck Of Heros 
3. Great Fortitude 
6. Lightning Reflex 
9. Toughness 
12. Skill Focus discipline 
15. Disarm (Required for Improved Version) 
18. Improved Disarm (discipline check versus lose weapon) 

Fighter Bonus Feats: 
1 Weapon focus Rapier 
2 Power Attack (required for Devastating Critical) 
4 Cleave (required for Devastating Critical) 
6 Knockdown (required for Improved Version) 
8 Great Cleave (required for Devastating Critical) 
10 Expertise 
12 Improved Expertise (Survivability +10 AC) 
14 Blind fight (Reduces Concealment on enemies significantly) 
16 Improved Critical Rapier 
18 Improved Knockdown (Discipline Check Versus Knockdown For enemies) 
20 Weapon Specialization Rapier 
22 Epic Weapon focus Rapier 
24 Epic Prowess 
26 Overwhelming Critical 
28 Devastating Critical 

Epic Feats (7) 
21 Great Strength 
24 Great Strength 
27 Great Strength 
30 Great Strength 
33 Great Strength 
36 Great Strength 
39 Armor Skin 


Skill Points: 
43 Discipline 
36 Listen (-1 wisdom mod = 35) 
8 Lore (Take at 1st bard, required for RDD) 
43 UMD (Required to use scrolls, such as True seeing, Improved Invisibility) 
12 Spellcraft (+3 Int Mod = 15) 
40 tumble 
7 Perform (-2 Cha Mode, 1 AB song) 
Any Extra put into Heal. 

35 Listen is required. Using CC and AMP potions for +30 listen, to reach 65 listen. Casting true seeing will then grant "True true seeing". 65 Spot also grants True True seeing. 

Stats 
AC: 74 (with Fighter Dodge item +10 Dodge from Constitution Modifier lose 2 for being RDD, +1 Mage Armor Potions) 
AB: 64 (With Aid Bless Potions) +1 Self Song = 65 
Dev DC: 53 

Notes: 
As this is an RDD, it does not benefit from Improved Parry or Dirty Fighting (please refer to fighter changes). Reflex is average with epic reflex ring. for acceptable reflex read alternatives 

Nib Fist item can be purchased from Epic Shop with Fame, highly recommended for such a high strength character. For further information regarding Nib fist please refer to the library in Tavern. 

Alternatives: 
There are many alternatives. Both Disarm and Improved Disarm can be dropped for other feats. Can move 1 bard before level 20 (lose 1 bab/ab) and gain a net feat and 2 reflex and take Epic Reflex by dropping improved disarm. High Reflex will help against spells such as Storm of Vengence, highly recommended. 

Changing Subrace is also possible, to Ogre for 2 more strength and even higher dev DC 54. Please note Ogre's will suffer size penalties along with other Ogre vulnerabilities. 

Other alternatives and variations involve Ranger Bard Rdd (Ranger Dodge), Paladin Bard Rdd (Divine Shield), Barbarian Bard Rdd (Low AC, Higher AB). 
-------------------- 
26 Bard 4 Blackguard(BG) 10 Red Dragon (RDD) 

Race 
Human (Subrace: None) 

Starting Stats: 
18 Strength 
8 Dexterity 
10 constitution 
14 Intelligence 
8 Wisdom 
14 charisma 

Attribute Allocation 
Every 4 levels increase Strength by 1 (by 10, by level 40). 

Leveling Order 
8 Bard (Take 5 hide 8 Lore), 4 RDD, 4 BG , 6 RDD, rest Bard. 

Preepic Feats (7) 
1: Power Attack (Required For Dev Crit) 
1: Blind fight (Reduces Concealment on enemies significantly) 
3 : Still Spell (To Cast/Dispel in Armor) 
6: Curse Song 
9: Cleave (Required For Dev Crit) 
12: Great Cleave (Required For Dev Crit) 
15: Divine Shield 
18: Weapon Focus Scimitar 

Epic Feats (7) 
21: Epic skill focus discipline 
24: Imp Crit Scimitar 
27: Epic Weapon focus Scimitar 
30: Epic Prowess 
33: Armor Skin 
36: Overwhelm Critical 
39: Devastating Critical 


Bard Feats 
23: Lasting Inspiration 
26: ESF Perform 

Skill Points: 
43 Discipline 
21 Listen (-1 wisdom modifier +15 song) 
8 Lore (Take on bard level before RDD, required for RDD) 
43 UMD (Required to use scrolls, such as True seeing, Improved Invisibility) 
5 Hide (Take on bard level as soon as possible, required for BG) 
40 Spellcraft 
40 tumble 
43 Perform 
43 Taunt 
Rest into Heal. 

35 Listen is required. Using CC and AMP potions for +30 listen, to reach 65 listen. Casting true seeing will then grant "True true seeing". 65 Spot also grants True True seeing. 

Stats 
AC: 76 (with +6 Song and Divine Shield, hitting and going over 20 Dodge Cap) 
AB: 62 (With Aid Bless Potions) +1 BG Bulls Strength Spell = 63 
Fortitude 50 

Notes: 
80 Perform on sheet is required to gain +6 song. Remove items (quickslot them) and put +4 perform items on until you have 80 Perform before singing for yourself. Song for 26 Bard is +6 ac +2 ab +2 all saves and +15 all skills. 

Alternatives: 
Can take 4 Paladin instead of 4 Blackguard for Fear Immunity. 
Can also drop Still Spell for Knockdown for Low discipline enemies. 
Epic Skill Focus Discipline can be dropped, but it will mean 1-2 more discipline items need to be used, and will hence lower reflex or will as those items could be used for them instead. 
Expertise and improved expertise highly recommended, but need to sacrifice for them. 

Subraces; also possible with Arctic Dwarf and Ljosalfar. Please note other subraces will lose over 40 skill points due to not being human. So, the best route would be to lower heal and spellcraft in such case. Arctic Dwarf is highly recommended option. 
-------------------- 
15 Monk, 10 Champion of Torm (COT), 15 Cleric 

Race 
Elf (Subrace: Darkelf) 

Cleric domains 
Trickery, Protection 

Starting Stats:(Subrace values) 
8 Strength (-2) 
20 Dexterity 
6 constitution 
12 Intelligence 
16 Wisdom (+4) 
8 charisma (-2) 

Attribute Allocation 
Every 4 levels increase Dexterity by 1 (by 10, by level 40). 

Leveling Order 
12 Monk, 4 Cot, 4 Cleric. Then fill in the rest and have Monk last level. 

Preepic Feats (7) 

1: Toughness 
3: Weapon finesse (Required to use dexterity for AB) 
6: Weapon Focus Kama 
9: Skill Focus Discipline 
12: Great Fortitude 
15: Extend Spell 
18: Two Weapon Fighting 

CoT bonus 
2 Blindfight 
4 Ambidexterity 

Epic Feats (7) 
21: Epic Skill focus Discipline 
24: Armor Skin 
27: Epic Fort 
30: Great Dexterity 
33: Great Dexterity 
36: Great Dexterity 
39: Great Dexterity 

CoT bonus 
6 Improved 2 Weapon fighting 
8 Epic weapon focus Kama 
10 Epic Prowess 

Skill Points: 
43 Discipline 
40 Tumble 
20 Listen (+11 Wis Mod +2 elf +2 alertness = 35) 
19 Spellcraft (+1 int mod =20) 
Rest into heal and concentration. 

35 Listen is required. Using CC and AMP potions for +30 listen, to reach 65 listen. Casting true seeing will then grant "True true seeing". 65 Spot also grants True True seeing. 

Stats 
AC: 77 
AB: 61 Dual Wield, 63 with 1 Kama 
Fortitude 50/51 
Discipline 81 (77 if 1 Kama) 

Gear:(11) 
Robe 5 AC 8 Constitution 
Belt 8 Dexterity 
Helmet 8 Wisdom 
Amulet 5 AC 4 wisdom 4 dexterity 
Cloak 5 AC 5 Fortitude 
Boot 5 AC 5 Fortitude 
Bracer 4 Discipline 
Ring 4 Discipline 
Ring 4 Disicpline 
Kama 4 Discipline + 5ench damage 
Kama 4 Discipline + 5ench damage 

Notes: 
No Strength on items rely on Divine Power. Use endurance spell for remainder 4 Con. due to low strength and with 3 or more monk levels, Strength must be used to resist Horns/EQ, therefore will fail at a high rate (Finesse cannot make it dexterity check due to 3+ monk levels). 

Protection Domain grants spell "Minor Globes" which crucially makes you immune to Horn. 

Alternatives: 
Can make it Unarmed, will then need to go 16 Monk 8 Cot 16 Cleric for d20 fists. Will need to drop Ambidexterity for Weapon focus Unarmed (WF Kama still required for CoT req), drop 2 weapon fighting for dodge. Losing 1 cot feat (Improved 2 weapon). And finally substitute EWF Kama with EWF Unarmed. 

Other varations and possibilties include: Cleric Monk with 2 Druid. Pally Monk Rogue, Pally Monk 2 Druid. 1 Druid level grants 2 ab outdoors wilderness only. 

-------------------- 
there are many 30-34 fighter builds (without Monk,PM) they will take 20 fighter preepic and the following feats. 

Normal Feats: 
1 SF Disc 
2 Light Reflex 
3 Iron Will 
4 Improved Parry (Increases natural ac by 1 every 5 fighter levels when use fighter item) 
5 dirty fighting (add's 1 ab per 10 fighter when use fighter item) 
6 Great Fortitude 
7 Choice 

fighter feats: 
1 Blind fight 
2 Weapon Focus 
4 Knockdown 
6 Weapon Specialization 
8 Power Attack 
10 Cleave 
12 Improved Knockdown 
14 Improved Critical 
16 Expertise 
18 Improved Expertise 
20 Great Cleave 

22 Armor Skin 
24 Epic Weapon focus 
26 Epic Prowess 
28 Overwhelming Critical 
30 Dev Critical 
32 Epic weapon Specialization (drop if 30 fighter) 

Epic feats 
4 or 6 great strength and epic skill focus discipline. 

Mix and match other classes. You will need to be strength based of course and a tumble class. Potentially very high saves possible with 5 harper scout levels, please check nwnwiki for HS requirements or your manual. 

-------------------- 

Following is a list of builds people typically make. 

10 3 27 Monk Bard AA (Dex or Wis(zen archer)) 
40 Wizard (Dual School, No Discipline, all out 52 Intelligence lots of Fortitude Feats) 
32 3 5 Ftr Bg HS (The so alled Str Saves Tank + Fighter Dodge + Divine Might) 
30 9 1 Ftr Pally Bard (Str+ Fighter Dodge) 
21 16 3 Monk Pally rogue (Dex, Good ab ac) 
30 9 1 Barbarian Monk Druid (Str Low AC, High AB) 
21 18 1 Barbarian Monk Druid (Str Low AC, High AB) 
33 5 2 Cleric HS Monk (Healer) 
20 19 1 Monk Rogue SD (Dex + UMD) 
30 Bard 10 Pale Master (Full Plate Support Bard) 
29 Sorceror 10 Pale 1 Pally (Caster) 
20 Fighter 19 Blackguard 1 Bard (Str + Fighter Dodge + Divine Might) 
26 Ranger 13 Rogue 1 Druid (Dex + Ranger Dodge) 
20 19 1 Fighter Weapon Master Bard (Str + Fighter Dodge) 
16 22 2 Pally CoT rogue (Dex + Divine Shield) 

Notes: 

-You can always test characters by making with [Test] in character name. 
-Typically aim for 74+ AC and 63+ AB. Discipline has to be good, with high Fortitude. Please refer to Library for changes with blackguard, fighter and ranger as they have been changed allot. 
-Blackguard and Paladin's add their charisma bonus to all saving throws. 
-The journal has information as to where to go and what to do during your early moments on the server, it's recommended to level with other players within your level range. 
-If further help is required do not hesitate to ask around. or send me a message on forums.
